sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This is Euronews Now. I'm Helena Humphrey. Here are your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Russia describes the explosions at an ammunitions depot in annexed Crimea as an act of sabotage without naming the perpetrators.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In the U.S., Republican Liz Cheney loses the Wyoming primary to a rival endorsed by Donald Trump.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: the Wyoming primary to a rival endorsed by Donald Trump.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And one year after the Taliban retook Kabul, a close aide of the former president tells our international correspondent why his government decided to flee Afghanistan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Russia is calling it sabotage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ukraine is admitting nothing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Either way, the explosions, this time at an ammunition depot in Russia-annexed Crimea, is unsettling Moscow and locals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Tuesday's blasts appear to be a second suspected Ukrainian attack on the peninsula in just over a week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's President Zelensky, in his nightly address, warned people in the area to be careful.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The queue to leave Crimea for Russia through the Kershensky Bridge in recent days proves that the absolute majority of citizens from the terrorist state are beginning to comprehend, or at least feel, that Crimea is no place for them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The blasts forced the evacuation of more than 3,000 people who lived nearby.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: There was shooting, there were explosions, shells falling right into backyards.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We had a shell in our backyard.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The guys came over to inspect it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We left everything, left it all as it was and took off. We came out to take a look and saw clouds of smoke coming out of the cow sheds where the military warehouses are.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We stayed there until about 7, 8 am.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Then there were explosions, flashes, debris falling on us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: On Thursday, UN Secretary-General Ant√≥nio Guterres, Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan and President Zelensky are to meet in Ukraine to discuss last month's UN-Turkey brokered grain deal and the attacks on the Zaporizhia nuclear power plant in southeastern Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Russia and Ukraine have blamed each other for the shelling near the nuclear plant, which Russian forces control.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The UN wants its nuclear inspectors to be given access to avert a possible disaster.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: As explosions destroyed Russian arsenal in Crimea, fighting continues across Ukraine on multiple fronts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Russian artillery pounds Ukrainian positions in Donetsk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Several homes have been reduced to rubble in the cities of Kramatorsk and Slovyansk, both of which have endured sustained shelling since war broke.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The front line has moved little in recent days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian forces are resisting the onslaught of Russian troops, encouraged by rumors of defections and divisions on the enemy side.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Reports suggest forces of the self-proclaimed Luhansk Republic are refusing to fight in Donetsk. and divisions on the enemy side. Reports suggest forces of the self-proclaimed Luhansk Republic are refusing to fight in Donetsk, fatigued after months of grueling clashes. In the Russian controlled territory, drinking water is distributed daily amid fears of triggering epidemics.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: There is also mounting fear of the terrible consequences of a radioactive leak at the Zaporizhia nuclear power plant, the largest in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Several strikes have targeted the site, sparking fears of a nuclear disaster.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: French President Emmanuel Macron called on Russia to withdraw its soldiers from the facility.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile there's been a surprise visit to former UN Secretary Ban Ki-moon and former Colombian President Jose Manuel Santos to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Both men visited Bucha, a city northwest of Kiev and the site of alleged Russian war crimes, where hundreds of civilians were found dead after the Russian withdrawal in late March. Brazil's far-right President Jair Bolsonaro has kicked off his campaign for re-election

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: in the same town where he was stabbed while campaigning there almost five years ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Addressing his supporters, he said he was grateful to the medics who saved him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I'm overcome with emotion to be back here, the town in which I was reborn, that saved me to become President of the Republic, which was the best thing for our country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: which was the best thing for our country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The race in Latin America's largest democracy is a clash between two strong candidates, with all others lagging far behind.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Former left-wing president Lula da Silva's campaign began at a Volkswagen plant outside Sao Paulo, where he rose to fame as a union leader.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He lost no time in slamming Bolsonaro's record during the pandemic. You, the Bolsonaro government, were denialist. You didn't believe in science. You didn't believe in medicine. You didn't believe in the governors. You just believed in your lie. Because if there's someone who's possessed by the devil, it's this Bolsonaro." Both candidates have been publicly rallying supporters for months. But Tuesday was the official start of what experts say is one of the most polarized campaigns in decades.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: There's trouble brewing in Kenya.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Opposition leader Railo Odinga has rejected the results of last week's tight presidential election which saw him lose to Deputy President William Ruto.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Odinga has vowed to pursue what he called all constitutional and legal options, calling the announcement of Ruto as the president-elect a travesty and blatant disregard of the constitution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And four of the seven electoral commissioners have explained why they disagree with Monday's results.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The commission's chairperson has conducted the election as though he is the national returning officer, a non-existent role, and his role in declaring results that were not approved by plenary by all seven commissioners renders the results unconstitutional.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: No presidential poll outcome has gone uncontested in Kenya since 2002 and in the past the disputes have led to bloodshed. Any challenge must be made to the Supreme Court by Monday which then has 14 days to bloodshed. Any challenge must be made to the Supreme Court by Monday, which then has 14 days to issue a ruling. But although violent protests erupted in several parts of the country loyal to Odinga on Monday, the situation appeared calm yesterday, as Kenyans wait to see what will happen next.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: next. wiping out of office. The winner has repeated Trump's false claim that the 2020 presidential election was stolen. US President Joe Biden has signed into law the 726 billion euro Inflation Reduction Act,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: which includes 368 billion euros to fight climate change, the most significant federal investment in history in the issue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The signing ceremony came just days after the House of Representatives approved the legislation in a party-line vote.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: A flagship of Biden's agenda, the bill could prove a boost ahead of the midterm elections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: A new blaze in Portugal has taken firefighters by surprise.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Breaking out on Sunday afternoon and rapidly gaining dimension. And the Serra da Estreia nightmare is far from over. Fire that devastated more than 14,000 hectares of the natural park reactivated on Monday afternoon. Spain's capital awoke to a light haze in the sky and a faint scent of burning due to the smoke carried by wind from Portugal's wildfires.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Madrid emergency services says the smoke had drifted some 350 kilometres. a difficult night battling a huge wildfire in the country's southeast that has burned through nearly 10 000 hectares in an area notoriously difficult to access the european union is on track for a record wildfire season spain romania and portugal are the worst affected eu members france has also been hard hit with more than 60,000 hectares burnt as of this week, surpassing the country's total for the entire 2019.
